content.body: shu, waldemar: Were you able to review the Async Explicit Resource Management proposal specification text?
content.formatted_body: shu, waldemar: Were you able to review the Async Explicit Resource Management proposal specification text?

content.body: Plenary begins in T-minus 1 minute encounting.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Plenary begins in T-minus 1 minute encounting.

content.body: rbuckton: i didn't have a chance to review the whole thing, but i did look at the `using await` sections of the draft spec
content.formatted_body: rbuckton: i didn't have a chance to review the whole thing, but i did look at the using await sections of the draft spec

content.body:
> <@shuyuguo:matrix.org> rbuckton: i didn't have a chance to review the whole thing, but i did look at the `using await` sections of the draft spec

The rest of the spec text that isn't `using await` is the same as the sync-version prior to carving `AsyncDisposableStack` and @@asyncDispose out in the November plenary.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @shuyuguo:matrix.org
rbuckton: i didn't have a chance to review the whole thing, but i did look at the using await sections of the draft spec
The rest of the spec text that isn't using await is the same as the sync-version prior to carving AsyncDisposableStack and @@asyncDispose out in the November plenary.

content.body: were there changes to using await? it looked like an exact mirror of the sync case, except plumbing through the `~async-dispose~` hint and awaiting disposable resources with that hint on block exit
content.formatted_body: were there changes to using await? it looked like an exact mirror of the sync case, except plumbing through the ~async-dispose~ hint and awaiting disposable resources with that hint on block exit
